meanings.definition: To stab or pierce with a bayonet.
meanings.sent1: The soldier bayonetted the enemy in close combat.
meanings.sent2: He bayonetted the target during training exercises.
meanings.sent3: The chef bayonetted the steak with precision, pretending the fork was a bayonet.
meanings.sent4: Her words bayonetted through his defenses, leaving him vulnerable.
meanings.sent5: The image of the bayonetted soldier haunted his dreams.

meanings.sent1: The museum displayed a collection of bayonetted rifles from the war.
meanings.sent2: He admired the craftsmanship of the bayonetted blade.
meanings.sent3: The bayonetted artifact was a prized possession of the history buff.
meanings.sent4: The bayonetted weapon symbolized the brutality of the past.
meanings.sent5: The bayonetted rifle had a storied past, evident in its worn handle.
